private_information: I specialize in normalizing informal action descriptions into machine-readable operator schemata.
I enumerate objects, predicates, and action parameters without inventing new tokens.
I infer simple static/dynamic predicate roles but do not emit PDDL.
modeler.goal: Extract a faithful operator schema set, object universe, and predicate inventory from the public information so that an orchestrator can later compile them into a Fast Downward-compatible PDDL domain and problem.

private_information: I audit temporal and causal consistency of given plans against action preconditions/effects.
I detect and remove bookkeeping shortcuts and post-hoc penalties; I only allow transitions justified by preconditions/effects.
I do not emit PDDL; I provide structured corrections and invariants.
consistency_auditor.goal: Validate the provided plan(s) step-by-step, produce a causal-link and open-conditions report, and propose minimal corrections to ensure logical soundness without inventing state facts.

private_information: I coordinate the team and produce the final PDDL artifacts.
I target the Fast Downward solver using standard STRIPS/ADL features that the FD translator accepts.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the modeler schemata and the auditor report to produce a single coherent PDDL domain and a single problem instance (for Scenario B) that Fast Downward can solve.

public_information: Use-case: I am playing with a set of objects and can apply the following actions over objects: Paltry object_0 object_1 object_2; Sip object_0 object_1 object_2; Clip object_0 object_1 object_2; Wretched object_0 object_1 object_2 object_3; Memory object_0 object_1 object_2; Tightfisted object_0 object_1 object_2.
Predicates (intended): hand(x); cats(x); sneeze(x); spring(x); stupendous(x); texture(x); next(x,y); vase(x,y); collect(x,y).
Action paltry(x=object_0, y=object_1, z=object_2) preconditions: hand x; cats y; texture z; vase x y; next y z. Effects add: next x z. Effects del: vase x y.
Action sip(x=object_0, y=object_1, z=object_2) preconditions: hand x; cats y; texture z; next x z; next y z. Effects add: vase x y. Effects del: next x z.
Action clip(x=object_0, y=object_1, z=object_2) preconditions: hand x; sneeze y; texture z; next y z; next x z. Effects add: vase x y. Effects del: next x z.

Action wretched(a=object_0, b=object_1, c=object_2, d=object_3) preconditions: sneeze a; texture b; texture c; stupendous d; next a b; collect b d; collect c d. Effects add: next a c. Effects del: next a b.
Action memory(x=object_0, y=object_1, z=object_2) preconditions: cats x; spring y; spring z; next x y. Effects add: next x z. Effects del: next x y.
Action tightfisted(x=object_0, y=object_1, z=object_2) preconditions: hand x; sneeze y; texture z; next y z; vase x y. Effects add: next x z. Effects del: vase x y.

Scenario A initial facts: cats object_0; cats object_1; collect object_10 object_3; collect object_11 object_3; collect object_6 object_2; collect object_7 object_2; collect object_8 object_2; collect object_9 object_3; hand object_12; hand object_13; hand object_14; next object_0 object_9; next object_1 object_6; next object_12 object_11; next object_13 object_8; next object_14 object_8; next object_4 object_7; next object_5 object_10; sneeze object_4; sneeze object_5; spring object_6; spring object_9; stupendous object_2; stupendous object_3; texture object_10; texture object_11; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8; texture object_9.
Scenario A goal: next object_12 object_6; next object_13 object_10; next object_14 object_11.

Scenario A plan sequence: wretched object_4 object_7 object_8 object_2; clip object_14 object_4 object_8; clip object_13 object_4 object_8; wretched object_4 object_8 object_6 object_2; tightfisted object_14 object_4 object_6; tightfisted object_13 object_4 object_6; sip object_14 object_1 object_6; sip object_13 object_1 object_6; memory object_1 object_6 object_9; paltry object_14 object_1 object_9; paltry object_13 object_1 object_9; wretched object_5 object_10 object_9 object_3; clip object_14 object_5 object_9; clip object_13 object_5 object_9; wretched object_5 object_9 object_10 object_3; tightfisted object_13 object_5 object_10; wretched object_5 object_10 object_11 object_3; tightfisted object_14 object_5 object_11; clip object_12 object_5 object_11; wretched object_5 object_11 object_9 object_3; tightfisted object_12 object_5 object_9; sip object_12 object_1 object_9; memory object_1 object_9 object_6; paltry object_12 object_1 object_6.

Scenario B initial facts: cats object_0; cats object_1; collect object_10 object_3; collect object_11 object_3; collect object_6 object_2; collect object_7 object_2; collect object_8 object_2; collect object_9 object_3; hand object_12; hand object_13; hand object_14; next object_0 object_6; next object_1 object_9; next object_12 object_11; next object_13 object_6; next object_14 object_8; next object_4 object_7; next object_5 object_10; sneeze object_4; sneeze object_5; spring object_6; spring object_9; stupendous object_2; stupendous object_3; texture object_10; texture object_11; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8; texture object_9.
Scenario B goal: next object_12 object_10; next object_13 object_10; next object_14 object_9.
Scenario B plan: to be synthesized by the system.

Notes: Treat cats, sneeze, spring, stupendous, texture, collect, hand as static properties of objects where applicable; next and vase are fluent predicates that can be added and deleted by actions; maintain consistent arities and argument roles across actions.

analysis.system_prompt: You are a domain modeling expert. From the public information, extract a clean list of object constants, a predicate inventory with arities, and normalized operator schemata with parameter names and typed hints if obvious. Do not produce PDDL; instead, produce a compact machine-readable schema that enumerates for each action: parameters, preconditions-positive, preconditions-negative if any, effects-add, effects-del. Also identify static predicates and dynamic predicates and suggest minimal typing categories. Do not invent new objects or predicates and do not assume hidden effects.
analysis.prompt: Your name is modeler. Use the provided public information {environment->public_information} and your private knowledge {agents->modeler->private_information} to produce a succinct schema and invariants suitable for compilation into PDDL later. Keep everything strictly aligned with the described actions, objects, and facts.

audit.system_prompt: You are a temporal and causal consistency auditor. You check that every plan step’s preconditions are satisfied by the current state and prior effects, and you reject bookkeeping shortcuts or unjustified fact changes. You produce a structured report including: open preconditions found, causal links, threats, suggestions for minimal repairs or reorderings, and a conservative list of invariants. Do not produce PDDL.
audit.prompt: Your name is consistency_auditor. Using the modeler’s schemata {schemata_modeler} and the public information {environment->public_information}, audit Scenario A’s plan strictly step-by-step and report any violations. Do not assume facts that are not present; if an action requires a missing precondition, flag it and propose the minimal fix consistent with the described operators.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert PDDL integrator targeting the Fast Downward solver. Integrate the provided schemata and audit report into a single consistent PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem instance for Scenario B. Use only features supported by Fast Downward’s translator (e.g., :strips and optionally :typing; avoid numeric fluents and avoid unsupported constructs). Ensure predicate names and arities match the source; treat static predicates as init facts only; encode add and delete effects precisely. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Produce the final domain and problem. Domain: include actions paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted exactly as modeled, using parameters and effects consistent with {schemata_modeler} and corrections from {audit_report}. Problem: instantiate Scenario B using the objects appearing in the public information, set the initial facts to Scenario B initial facts exactly, and set the goal to Scenario B goal exactly. Target Fast Downward; keep names lowercase, provide :requirements at least :strips and :typing if you used types; ensure the problem references the domain by name. Output only the two tagged PDDL artifacts.
